titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Archibald Getty & Co. were general commission merchants and cotton factors in Charleston, South Carolina. Thomas, Theodore, John, and Archibald Getty The SS Moneka was built by William Cramp and Sons.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of business volumes of the Getty Company, Charleston, South Carolina, 1867-1870. Volumes include a receipt book for payments related to shipboard and domestic expenses; a cash book, which documents shipping, freight, and merchandise transactions; an account book for commercial and private customers; and a ledger listing all costs related to ships' voyages, including advertising, storage, and commissioning. Ships include the SS Moneka, the SS Prometheus, the SS E.B. Souder, the SS J.W. Everman, and the SS Zodiac.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
